Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with reserved dot in centre and traces of added red and white decoration outside; exterior: reserved; foot glazed streaky black; underside reserved with some trace of white slip; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number 765 is written in pencil on the underside of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1056) (phase 2)
